tn.text: These verses begin a section that tells about the coming attack against Jerusalem and how God will rescue the city.
This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.
"the one who created the sky"

tn.ref: laid the foundation of the earth
tn.text: AT: "put all the earth into place"

tn.ref: fashions the spirit of mankind within man
tn.text: AT: "creates the human spirit"
"cup of something to drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: causing all the peoples surrounding her to stagger about
tn.text: That is, the drink is alcoholic and will cause the armies attacking Jerusalem to become drunk and unable to fight. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
That is, the city of Jerusalem. It was common in Hebrew to speak of a city or country as if it were a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: heavy stone for all the peoples
tn.text: "something impossible to move" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These verses continue telling about the coming attack against Jerusalem and how God will rescue the city.
This refers to the day that the armies attack Jerusalem.
This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: I will look with favor on
tn.text: AT: "I will protect"
"the people of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means they will think and say to themselves.
AT: "because they worship Yahweh of hosts"
This verse continues telling about the coming attack against Jerusalem and how God will rescue the city.
This refers to the time when Jerusalem is attacked and God defeats her enemies.

tn.ref: like firepots among wood ... standing grain
tn.text: "like firepots among stacked firewood ... unharvested stalks of grain standing in a field" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
clay pots in which ancient people often carried burning coals
a wooden stick that is burning at one end which gives light as one travels or carries fire somewhere

tn.ref: will consume all the surrounding peoples
tn.text: "will destroy the surrounding peoples" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Jerusalem will again live in her own place
tn.text: The people of Jerusalem will again live in their own city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
These verses continue telling about the coming attack against Jerusalem and how God will rescue the city.
Here "tents" represents homes, and homes represent the people who live in them. AT: "the people of Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Possible meanings are 1) the descendants of David or 2) the ruling class of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is an angel sent by Yahweh to protect the people.

tn.ref: I will pour out a spirit of compassion and pleading
tn.text: AT: "I will give the people a spirit to have mercy on others and to pray to me for mercy"
AT: "the one whom they stabbed to death"

tn.ref: the laments in Jerusalem will be like the laments at Hadad Rimmon
tn.text: Hadad Rimmon may have been the place where the good King Josiah died of battle wounds after the Battle of Megiddo. It appears that the custom arose to hold periodic mourning there for his death. Some people, however, think that Hadad Rimmon was the name of a false god who was believed to die every year, an event for which his worshipers would go into mourning.
This is the name of a plain in Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]).
This refers to all the people living in the land of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the house of David ... of Nathan ... of Levi
tn.text: The descendants of David ... of Nathan ... of Levi. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
